title: Doctor Who - Season 19 - (1982) - 26 Episodes
description:
The nineteenth season of British science fiction television series Doctor Who began with 'Castrovalva', and ended with 'Time-Flight'. The entire season was broadcast from 4 January 1982 to 30 March 1982.

Season 19 introduces Peter Davison as The Fifth Doctor. Tegan Jovanka (Janet Fielding), Nyssa (Sarah Sutton), Adric (Matthew Waterhouse) are his companions. 'Earthshock' is the rare instance, in the series, where one of the companions actually die.

Anthony Ainley returns again in 'Castrovalva' and 'Time-Flight' as the Master.

'Black Orchid' was the first purely historical story, with no science-fiction elements save for the TARDIS and its crew, since 'The Highlanders' from Season 4; it was also the first two-part serial since 'The Sontaran Experiment' in Season 12, and the first of a regular run of a two-parter every season until the change of format to 45 minute episodes in Season 22.

26 Episodes Total:

01 - Castrovalva - 4 Episodes

     Synopsis: The newly regenerated Doctor is in a vulnerable state. His
     regeneration failing, the Doctor and his companions go to the city of
     Castrovalva to let him recover.

02 - Four to Doomsday - 4 Episodes

     Synopsis: The Fifth Doctor, Nyssa, Tegan and Adric arrive on a spaceship
     which is headed for Earth. On board they meet natives of Earth from various
     eras.

03 - Kinda - 4 Episodes

     Synopsis: When Tegan sleeps near the wind chimes she is confronted by the
     true evil that threatens Deva Loka.

04 - The Visitation - 4 Episodes

     Synopsis: The TARDIS arrives in 1666. Villainous creatures known as
     Terileptils are hatching an evil plan and the Doctor and his friends must
     stop them before the whole village is wiped out.

05 - Black Orchid - 2 Episodes

     Synopsis: At a masked ball at Cranleigh Hall a series of murders begins. The
     Doctor must uncover the secret the Cranleigh family is hiding from the world.

06 - Earthshock - 4 Episodes

     Synopsis: The TARDIS drops the Fifth Doctor and his companions in the middle
     of an investigation into the murder of a team of scientists in a complex of
     caves. Deadly androids are patrolling the tunnels, but what are they
     protecting... and for whom are they working?

07 - Time-Flight - 4 Episodes

     Synopsis: Missing Concordes lead the Fifth Doctor on a curious mission back
     in time where a deadly foe is seeking to seize control of the ancient powers
     of the Xeraphin.
